SEARCH
Package assignment.test.util

Class TaskManager

java.lang.Object
assignment.test.util.TaskManager
public class TaskManager extends Object
This class is intended to manage the sub-processes of the main Main program.

Sub Processes:
  • Read and store data from an Excel file
  • Initialize and run the UI for user input
  • Write trip data to new Excel file

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    private static final InputFileHandler
    DATA

    Gets the output XML file name and returns it
    static void
    outputTripResults()
    Uses the AbstractPoiWriteElementDataList class to write the trip data to a new Excel file with a unique filename.
    static void
    processDataFile()
    Uses the InputFileHandler class to read an Excel file and convert its data into PlanetaryBody and TransportationVehicle objects; then, stores them in separate arrays in the PlanetaryBodyData and TransportationVehicleData classes.
    static void
    run()
    Uses the PlanetaryDialog and UIHandler classes to run the UI in an infinite loop until the user chooses to stop inputting data.

    Each iteration of the loop will prompt the user for 3 inputs: a starting planet a destination planet a transportation vehicle
    Those details will be used to create a Trip object that will be appended to an array in the TripData class

    Sets the output Excel file name

    Uses the OutputXmlHandler class to write the trip data to an XML file.

  • Constructor Details

    • TaskManager

      private TaskManager()
      This is an explicit default constructor for a class of static methods.

  • Method Details

    • processDataFile

      public static void processDataFile()
      Uses the InputFileHandler class to read an Excel file and convert its data into PlanetaryBody and TransportationVehicle objects; then, stores them in separate arrays in the PlanetaryBodyData and TransportationVehicleData classes.

    • run

      public static void run()
      Uses the PlanetaryDialog and UIHandler classes to run the UI in an infinite loop until the user chooses to stop inputting data.

      Each iteration of the loop will prompt the user for 3 inputs:
      • a starting planet
      • a destination planet
      • a transportation vehicle

      Those details will be used to create a Trip object that will be appended to an array in the TripData class

    • outputTripResults

      public static void outputTripResults()
      Uses the AbstractPoiWriteElementDataList class to write the trip data to a new Excel file with a unique filename.

    • WriteToExcel

      public static void WriteToExcel()
      Uses the OutputExcelHandler class to write the trip data to an Excel file.

    • WriteToXML

      public static void WriteToXML()
      Uses the OutputXmlHandler class to write the trip data to an XML file.
